commit_message:
Fix VirtualInterfacePlugException message info

In vif.py plug method, the HttpError exception reason
will be specified to make VirtualInterfacePlugException
raised more meaningful.

In SRIOV vif driver plug code, if no ethernet ports are
found on a physical network for an instance then instead
of vif details this change will furnish instance mac
address as more meaningful data to user.

Change-Id: Ia9072f45829018c51ba42e5cb032bff7d7eadd23
Closes-bug: #1661609
(cherry picked from commit 2fcd97e1b38452dbf6492639b923417d4d7e93e4)

combine vitrage dsvm jobs as one pattern

The "{pipeline}-vitrage-dsvm-{suite}-{node}{suffix}" jobs
of vitrage project only have one different field(suite).
Combine them as one pattern so it's much easier to extend.

subject: Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 20:06:20.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/api/v1/cloudfoundry/test_cfapi.py'], 'message': 'Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.

Backported from master branch.

Currently, test_cfapi appears to be conflicting with other
unit tests [1][2] (see gate-murano-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
in each case).

This is because test_cfapi has a helper method called
_set_override that calls oslo_config.cfg.set_override without
using clearing the overrides during tearDown (i.e. by calling
self.addCleanup(oslo_config.cfg.clear_override) for all
the values that were overriden with set_override.

The tests are always run in random order (i.e. with tox -e py27)
so the conflict does not appear to be deterministic or
guaranteed across all test runs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433724/1
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429978/

Change-Id: I49cae9fdf233c670ccef512ba430923122971e30
(cherry picked from commit 9a90e9d443191210141130955df331dfc86ea368)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.

Backported from master branch.

Currently, test_cfapi appears to be conflicting with other
unit tests [1][2] (see gate-murano-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
in each case).

This is because test_cfapi has a helper method called
_set_override that calls oslo_config.cfg.set_override without
using clearing the overrides during tearDown (i.e. by calling
self.addCleanup(oslo_config.cfg.clear_override) for all
the values that were overriden with set_override.

The tests are always run in random order (i.e. with tox -e py27)
so the conflict does not appear to be deterministic or
guaranteed across all test runs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433724/1
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429978/

Change-Id: I49cae9fdf233c670ccef512ba430923122971e30
(cherry picked from commit 9a90e9d443191210141130955df331dfc86ea368)

subject: Tolerate jsonschema==2.6.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 13:19:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_api_validation.py'], 'message': 'Tolerate jsonschema==2.6.0

Latest jsonschema changes the exception messages. In this
changeset, we assert that the exception message should be
either the one generated by the old library or one from the
new library. Ideally, we should not be string comparing the
error messages at all.

Change-Id: I2faca143c72005c42ef9ce5576013390d0475fb6
'}]
commit_message:
Tolerate jsonschema==2.6.0

Latest jsonschema changes the exception messages. In this
changeset, we assert that the exception message should be
either the one generated by the old library or one from the
new library. Ideally, we should not be string comparing the
error messages at all.

Change-Id: I2faca143c72005c42ef9ce5576013390d0475fb6

commit_message:
Fix NameError in metadef_namespaces.py

In glance/api/v2/metadef_namespaces.py, on line 208,
exception is used instead of Exception for catching
generic exception, which will result in NameError.

Changed exception to Exception to resolve this.

Change-Id: Idb18754d9ba7349dd6c703147841f3eaeb7484e5

commit_message:
Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.

Backported from master branch.

Currently, test_cfapi appears to be conflicting with other
unit tests [1][2] (see gate-murano-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
in each case).

This is because test_cfapi has a helper method called
_set_override that calls oslo_config.cfg.set_override without
using clearing the overrides during tearDown (i.e. by calling
self.addCleanup(oslo_config.cfg.clear_override) for all
the values that were overriden with set_override.

The tests are always run in random order (i.e. with tox -e py27)
so the conflict does not appear to be deterministic or
guaranteed across all test runs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433724/1
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429978/

Change-Id: I327925c5bf3190fb5d9f3ea4fb17d21d0b9e1a6d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 17:55:49.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Put neutron config at the top of the local.conf file

When a multi-node job runs it addes a neutron config section to the
local.conf file. This causes an issue for a grenade job which enables
a devstack plugin as the 'enable_plugin' line will be in the neutron
config section.

Place the neutron config section at the top of the local.conf file to
fix this issue.

Change-Id: I5768689d035257601c1145255dc9b7b8613896f8
"}]
commit_message:
Put neutron config at the top of the local.conf file

When a multi-node job runs it addes a neutron config section to the
local.conf file. This causes an issue for a grenade job which enables
a devstack plugin as the 'enable_plugin' line will be in the neutron
config section.

Place the neutron config section at the top of the local.conf file to
fix this issue.

Change-Id: I5768689d035257601c1145255dc9b7b8613896f8

commit_message:
align packages to make setuptools/pbr happy

Previously it was ok that the fs name was devstack, and the package on
pypi was devstack-tools, but something changed (probably setuptools)
so this isn't any more. change out package name to make all of that
happy.

Change-Id: I5b0008a8f10c99b9c19edad9617316edf89daf17

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-13 22:13:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py', 'nova/cmd/status.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py', 'nova/scheduler/client/report.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/test_report_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/placement-api-endpoint-interface-set-29af8b9400ce7775.yaml', 'nova/conf/placement.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup some issues with CONF.placement.os_interface

This change fixes a few things with the recently added
"os_interface" option in the [placement] config group.

1. It adds tests for the scheduler report client that
   were missing in the original change that added the
   config option.

2. It uses the option in the "nova-status upgrade check"
   command so it is consistent with how the scheduler
   report client uses it.

3. It removes the restrictive choices list from the
   config option definition. keystoneauth1 allows an
   "auth" value for the endpoint interface which means
   don't use the service catalog to find the endpoint
   but instead just read it from the "auth_url" config
   option. Also, the Keystone v3 API performs strict
   validation of the endpoint interface when creating
   an endpoint record. The list of supported interfaces
   may change over time, so we shouldn't encode that
   list within Nova.

4. As part of removing the choices, the release note
   associated with the new option is updated and changed
   from a 'feature' release note to simply 'other' since
   it's not really a feature as much as it is a bug fix.

Change-Id: Ia5af05cc4d8155349bab942280c83e7318749959
Closes-Bug: #1664334
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup some issues with CONF.placement.os_interface

This change fixes a few things with the recently added
"os_interface" option in the [placement] config group.

1. It adds tests for the scheduler report client that
   were missing in the original change that added the
   config option.

2. It uses the option in the "nova-status upgrade check"
   command so it is consistent with how the scheduler
   report client uses it.

3. It removes the restrictive choices list from the
   config option definition. keystoneauth1 allows an
   "auth" value for the endpoint interface which means
   don't use the service catalog to find the endpoint
   but instead just read it from the "auth_url" config
   option. Also, the Keystone v3 API performs strict
   validation of the endpoint interface when creating
   an endpoint record. The list of supported interfaces
   may change over time, so we shouldn't encode that
   list within Nova.

4. As part of removing the choices, the release note
   associated with the new option is updated and changed
   from a 'feature' release note to simply 'other' since
   it's not really a feature as much as it is a bug fix.

Change-Id: Ia5af05cc4d8155349bab942280c83e7318749959
Closes-Bug: #1664334

subject: [WIP] Reorganize proxy documentation by resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-02 17:28:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/users/proxies/compute.rst'], 'message': "[WIP] Reorganize proxy documentation by resource

This is an incomplete example of how we could organize our docs by
resource so it's easier to find what you're looking for instead of just
receiving a huge list of methods that are ordered by how they exist in
the source code.

If we go this way, we'll need some sort of Sphinx extension to know
if a method has been left out of the docs, since this would
then become somewhat of a manual process. autodoc does emit some events
that we can watch to compare what's being added to the docs versus what
the public methods are on a class.

Change-Id: I34def6a6ea594d3996010feaf1054335725aa5c0
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Reorganize proxy documentation by resource

This is an incomplete example of how we could organize our docs by
resource so it's easier to find what you're looking for instead of just
receiving a huge list of methods that are ordered by how they exist in
the source code.

If we go this way, we'll need some sort of Sphinx extension to know
if a method has been left out of the docs, since this would
then become somewhat of a manual process. autodoc does emit some events
that we can watch to compare what's being added to the docs versus what
the public methods are on a class.

Change-Id: I34def6a6ea594d3996010feaf1054335725aa5c0

commit_message:
VMAX driver - snapshot creation and immediate deletion fix

Creating and immediately deleting a snapshot greater than 50GB
fails. This patch rectifies the issue by passing the
WaitForCopyState parameter into the CreateElementReplica SMI-S
function when creating the snapshot.

Change-Id: I5aa4a77cb8208bb805551074a28d8b722d6eb22c
Closes-Bug: #1662950

commit_message:
vmutils: Adds remove_all_pci_devices method

When resizing an imported VM, nova does not specify which
PCI devices needs to be attached and which needs to be detached.
Thus, all the VM's PCI devices needs to be detached, and reattached
according to the new PCI request.

Change-Id: Ia7fbb2a9bc8f5d21bf5ec4a865fc7b1368ecf136
Partial-Bug: #1663238

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-15 17:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/metrics/metricsutils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_vmutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/vmutils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/metrics/test_metricsutils.py'], 'message': 'removes the VirtualSystemType kwarg when fetching VMs

A VM can be either "Realized" or "Planned", but not both. Thus,
using the VirtualSystemType as a filter is not useful.

Because of this, the "is_planned_vm" argument from vmutils
methods will no longer be unused, and will be removed once it is
no longer used.

This will make vmutils easier to use for Planned VMs, which will
be used for cold migration in the future. Plus, not all vmutils
methods have the "is_planned_vm" argument, which would have been
necessary in order to update the Planned VM (e.g.: get_vm_config_dir method).

Partial-Bug: #1663238

Change-Id: Ic153dcfd621a1e6235dd3a75241274ee7d7c868b
'}]
commit_message:
removes the VirtualSystemType kwarg when fetching VMs

A VM can be either "Realized" or "Planned", but not both. Thus,
using the VirtualSystemType as a filter is not useful.

Because of this, the "is_planned_vm" argument from vmutils
methods will no longer be unused, and will be removed once it is
no longer used.

This will make vmutils easier to use for Planned VMs, which will
be used for cold migration in the future. Plus, not all vmutils
methods have the "is_planned_vm" argument, which would have been
necessary in order to update the Planned VM (e.g.: get_vm_config_dir method).

Partial-Bug: #1663238

Change-Id: Ic153dcfd621a1e6235dd3a75241274ee7d7c868b

commit_message:
Force yum to do a full cache delete after repos configuration

In certain scenarios, as the upgrade ones where
both old and new version repos have the same name
we need to ensure that the full yum cache is recreated
after new repos are configured.

Closes-Bug: #1663579

Change-Id: Iff559c70e1dc11b01b9e1954ee5170a2b4c7b724

commit_message:
Invert device_owner to avoid filtering too much

In an earlier change[1], a filter was added to avoid Linuxbridge races
with Nova. This filter breaks anything else using device owners other
than n(eutron|etwork):.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193485/

Closes-Bug: #1524004
Closes-Bug: #1664659
Change-Id: I31a8e0e255b8b0251c991d5e20a4b9441d4ec489

subject: VMAX driver - copy state fix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-08 18:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/provision_v3.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/dell_emc/test_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell_emc/vmax/common.py'], 'message': "VMAX driver - copy state fix

Creating a cloned volume can fail when the source volume
is bigger than 50 GB. This occurs when we try to unlink the
source from target before all the tracks are copied.
This patch fixes the issue by adding a 'WaitForCopyState'
parameter to the CreateElementReplica SMI-S function.

Change-Id: Iac8ce48dda6f21a49838e4ca900a4f3ba1a9b2a7
Closes-Bug: #1660378
(cherry picked from commit d43395d0af0445a9375e25110298ccfd3f3dff81)
"}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - copy state fix

Creating a cloned volume can fail when the source volume
is bigger than 50 GB. This occurs when we try to unlink the
source from target before all the tracks are copied.
This patch fixes the issue by adding a 'WaitForCopyState'
parameter to the CreateElementReplica SMI-S function.

Change-Id: Iac8ce48dda6f21a49838e4ca900a4f3ba1a9b2a7
Closes-Bug: #1660378
(cherry picked from commit d43395d0af0445a9375e25110298ccfd3f3dff81)

commit_message:
allocations.consumer_id is not used in query.

PostGreSQL required consumer_id in group by clause, but
consumer_id is not being used in the query and is superfluous.

Change-Id: I47b758b949b7fbed70906e9a95cbe7bb99da13c2
Closes-Bug: 1662012
(cherry picked from commit 85c76a7f0827ff8f278d071a0b3f721847079711)
(cherry picked from commit b257e5ad45fffbbd90e5e6e9f4b013a9a0b4291b)

subject: Use the latest 0.3.5 version of CirrOS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-12 22:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Use the latest 0.3.5 version of CirrOS

This new version of CirrOS is built on top of 0.3 branch, so wrt
version 0.3.4 it includes only two commits:

- Cherry-pick of the fix for https://launchpad.net/bugs/1564948
- One extra fix to make the above working on 0.3

Cherry-picked commit is http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cirros-dev/cirros/trunk/revision/366

A Tempest test for hard reboot in some cases hits the case where
host key are empty. This triggers bugs/1564948, i.e. the ssh
daemon does not start at all, and the Tempest test fails with
"connection refused", which is misleading.

The new version of CirrOS solves this problem as it ensure host
keys are generated if missing, and the sshd deamon started.

I tested the scenario of missing host keys in Iea74c63925be17a1df894c1a2c23f5ba2793e0c6
using a private build of what then became 0.3.5.

Change-Id: I5c154ec25555e768954538fc22b4f5d5975b2deb
'}]
commit_message:
Use the latest 0.3.5 version of CirrOS

This new version of CirrOS is built on top of 0.3 branch, so wrt
version 0.3.4 it includes only two commits:

- Cherry-pick of the fix for https://launchpad.net/bugs/1564948
- One extra fix to make the above working on 0.3

Cherry-picked commit is http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~cirros-dev/cirros/trunk/revision/366

A Tempest test for hard reboot in some cases hits the case where
host key are empty. This triggers bugs/1564948, i.e. the ssh
daemon does not start at all, and the Tempest test fails with
"connection refused", which is misleading.

The new version of CirrOS solves this problem as it ensure host
keys are generated if missing, and the sshd deamon started.

I tested the scenario of missing host keys in Iea74c63925be17a1df894c1a2c23f5ba2793e0c6
using a private build of what then became 0.3.5.

Change-Id: I5c154ec25555e768954538fc22b4f5d5975b2deb

subject: Don't limit creation of undercloud.conf to baremetal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 20:00:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/installation/installing.rst'], 'message': "Don't limit creation of undercloud.conf to baremetal

Now that we support a wider variety of virtual environments, it's
quite likely that developers and testers will need to create an
undercloud.conf for them as well.  Since it won't hurt to create
undercloud.conf even when using all the defaults, let's just make
it a non-optional step.

Change-Id: I6c12391dd3e66bd1fbc706f2d936aab543376388
"}]
commit_message:
Don't limit creation of undercloud.conf to baremetal

Now that we support a wider variety of virtual environments, it's
quite likely that developers and testers will need to create an
undercloud.conf for them as well.  Since it won't hurt to create
undercloud.conf even when using all the defaults, let's just make
it a non-optional step.

Change-Id: I6c12391dd3e66bd1fbc706f2d936aab543376388

commit_message:
fix the deliverable type for designate-tempest-plugin

We do not track "tempest-plugin" as a type of deliverable, for now. This
data was imported when the tags were migrated from governance to this
repo and before the validation logic for the deliverable type was added.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove straggling use of main db flavors in cellsv1 code

This remaining use of the flavor query routine from the cellsv1 code
still looks at the main database. This patch converts it to use the
object which looks in the right place

Change-Id: I2ad2900a2f3ca043626e20de953ffcfc58a71d27
Closes-Bug: #1663729

subject: Use netloc_no_port for trusted-host in pip.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 13:13:49.000000000', 'files': ['templates/pip.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Use netloc_no_port for trusted-host in pip.conf

The move to templating pip.conf has caused an issue with trusted-hosts,
The value requires no port, and will fail if a port is specified. This
patch resolves that by using the "netloc_no_port" filter instead of the
"netloc" filter.

Change-Id: I9cca5138934eee438906ac25d165d128c2411e31
'}]
commit_message:
Use netloc_no_port for trusted-host in pip.conf

The move to templating pip.conf has caused an issue with trusted-hosts,
The value requires no port, and will fail if a port is specified. This
patch resolves that by using the "netloc_no_port" filter instead of the
"netloc" filter.

Change-Id: I9cca5138934eee438906ac25d165d128c2411e31

subject: We intend to add 10 stack_snapshot to the test data but only got 1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 14:21:22.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/heat_data.py'], 'message': "We intend to add 10 stack_snapshot to the test data but only got 1

    the same snapshot 'id' being added to the TestDataContainer in the iteration,
    so we only got 1 finally. Make the 'id' different for each add() method.

Change-Id: Ie62b08c4e898d6ca7c4f75808fcb4119cd92d9ec
"}]
commit_message:
We intend to add 10 stack_snapshot to the test data but only got 1

    the same snapshot 'id' being added to the TestDataContainer in the iteration,
    so we only got 1 finally. Make the 'id' different for each add() method.

Change-Id: Ie62b08c4e898d6ca7c4f75808fcb4119cd92d9ec

subject: Repair unused rollback_reader_sessions parameter.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 21:54:33.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py'], 'message': 'Repair unused rollback_reader_sessions parameter.

The rollback_reader_sessions parameter on
_TransactionContext is unused; it is instead acquired from the
top level factory.  Remove the parameter and also move the
documentation for it up to _TransactionFactory.configure_defaults.
As there was no documentation for parameters here, add docs
for all the other parameters too.

Change-Id: I30a2548ad038ae218933c5802c6a8b761705d834
'}]
commit_message:
Repair unused rollback_reader_sessions parameter.

The rollback_reader_sessions parameter on
_TransactionContext is unused; it is instead acquired from the
top level factory.  Remove the parameter and also move the
documentation for it up to _TransactionFactory.configure_defaults.
As there was no documentation for parameters here, add docs
for all the other parameters too.

Change-Id: I30a2548ad038ae218933c5802c6a8b761705d834

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-02-03 18:26:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR: Remove un-necessary snapshot in online copy operation

While doing an online copy in the 3PAR, we create a temporary
snapshot of source volume to do the data copy operation.

Online copy is a feature in 3PAR whereby a copy initiated
on a source volume , and when the data copy is in progress,
the target volume of the copy is immediately available for
volume attachment and performing I/O is allowed on that volume
Resynching the source and the destination volume is
done automatically by the 3PAR internally.

Reasoning behind removing the temporary snapshot of the source
volume is that, internally 3PAR creates a temporary snapshot
and extra snapshot created by Cinder 3PAR Driver is un-necessary.

Also this temporary snapshot is not cleaned up on the
completion of online copy operation.

The presence of the temporary snapshot during the volume copy
operation is confirmed by running the "showtask" on the
asynchronous task id.

Change-Id: Ia2cb70e77211a372f73eaf577dbf57715c5a363f
Closes-Bug: 1661541
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Remove un-necessary snapshot in online copy operation

While doing an online copy in the 3PAR, we create a temporary
snapshot of source volume to do the data copy operation.

Online copy is a feature in 3PAR whereby a copy initiated
on a source volume , and when the data copy is in progress,
the target volume of the copy is immediately available for
volume attachment and performing I/O is allowed on that volume
Resynching the source and the destination volume is
done automatically by the 3PAR internally.

Reasoning behind removing the temporary snapshot of the source
volume is that, internally 3PAR creates a temporary snapshot
and extra snapshot created by Cinder 3PAR Driver is un-necessary.

Also this temporary snapshot is not cleaned up on the
completion of online copy operation.

The presence of the temporary snapshot during the volume copy
operation is confirmed by running the "showtask" on the
asynchronous task id.

Change-Id: Ia2cb70e77211a372f73eaf577dbf57715c5a363f
Closes-Bug: 1661541

subject: Fix unnecessary sync in db consistent
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-15 10:43:33.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/db_consistent.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_db_consistent.py'], 'message': 'Fix unnecessary sync in db consistent

when both the version of df object and the version of local object
is 0, the db consistent logic will always think the version of local
object is None and do update sync operation

Change-Id: I7543e480992f67674fa90e2841989e2939dee8b9
Closes-bug: #1664482
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unnecessary sync in db consistent

when both the version of df object and the version of local object
is 0, the db consistent logic will always think the version of local
object is None and do update sync operation

Change-Id: I7543e480992f67674fa90e2841989e2939dee8b9
Closes-bug: #1664482

Current N342 is the nova check for central conf files.
[N342] Config options should be in the central location nova/conf/
We can just remove it from the ignore list. Hopefully, future rule
will be added in neutron-lib for such check in networking project.

Change-Id: Ib4d3eadeb100ea26f7ccfeaca14a219c29e43c2e

(cherry picked from commit bc5df105eabfaf4e3de409a6853173a47bd3878f)

commit_message:
Remove  N342 from pep8 ignore list

Current N342 is the nova check for central conf files.
[N342] Config options should be in the central location nova/conf/
We can just remove it from the ignore list. Hopefully, future rule
will be added in neutron-lib for such check in networking project.

Change-Id: Ib4d3eadeb100ea26f7ccfeaca14a219c29e43c2e
Partial-Bug: #1663864
(cherry picked from commit bc5df105eabfaf4e3de409a6853173a47bd3878f)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-15 11:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix Python tempest gate

When monasca-common is installed from source for the API, it does
not follow upper constraints so it is installing PyMySQL-0.7.10.
When the API is installed, it is does a pip_install PyMySQL which
uses the upper constraints so it wants to use PyMySQL-0.7.9. The
install fails uninstalling PyMySQL-0.7.10.

Change the installs for monasca components from source to use upper
constraints using the devstack utility function setup_install.

Change to use upper constraints with pip_install.

Change-Id: I6535f131bcc1be2ed06b7011da51a6ac887ec2ee
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Python tempest gate

When monasca-common is installed from source for the API, it does
not follow upper constraints so it is installing PyMySQL-0.7.10.
When the API is installed, it is does a pip_install PyMySQL which
uses the upper constraints so it wants to use PyMySQL-0.7.9. The
install fails uninstalling PyMySQL-0.7.10.

Change the installs for monasca components from source to use upper
constraints using the devstack utility function setup_install.

Change to use upper constraints with pip_install.

Change-Id: I6535f131bcc1be2ed06b7011da51a6ac887ec2ee

subject: Use buffer to cache original data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 12:07:26.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l3_app.py'], 'message': "Use buffer to cache original data

The l3_app.L3App acts as learning router. Every routing will create
a OpenFlow rule for following packets, while the first packet also
needs to put back to the OpenFlow pipeline.

The original code doesn't add action to output to a port, so the
packet is siliently dropped.

This patch uses a buffer at datapath to store the packet, and specify
the buffer when add flow. The stored packet will be processed by the
new flow, so the pipeline is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib40d3d0204d719503be52946fdb159e059bde2f2
Closes-Bug: #1663515
(cherry picked from commit 8f50b6ec49278fc0a17c1d11da623084f8a6d04e)
"}]
commit_message:
Use buffer to cache original data

The l3_app.L3App acts as learning router. Every routing will create
a OpenFlow rule for following packets, while the first packet also
needs to put back to the OpenFlow pipeline.

The original code doesn't add action to output to a port, so the
packet is siliently dropped.

This patch uses a buffer at datapath to store the packet, and specify
the buffer when add flow. The stored packet will be processed by the
new flow, so the pipeline is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib40d3d0204d719503be52946fdb159e059bde2f2
Closes-Bug: #1663515
(cherry picked from commit 8f50b6ec49278fc0a17c1d11da623084f8a6d04e)

dating pretty far back, but in the real world no one really uses AMI

commit_message:
Switch devstack to use qcow cirros img

This commit switches devstack to use the published qcow2 cirros image
instead of the AMI version. Using AMI was mostly a historical artifact
dating pretty far back, but in the real world no one really uses AMI
images with openstack clouds. This change reflects that and also
enables tempest ro remove its deprecated config options for using AMI
as a fallback on misconfiguration (which was just there to support
devstack's defaults)

Change-Id: Id65ebae73b28da7185cb349b714b659af51ef77f

subject: Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 20:18:04.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/api/v1/cloudfoundry/test_cfapi.py'], 'message': 'Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.

Currently, test_cfapi appears to be conflicting with other
unit tests [1][2] (see gate-murano-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
in each case).

This is because test_cfapi has a helper method called
_set_override that calls oslo_config.cfg.set_override without
using clearing the overrides during tearDown (i.e. by calling
self.addCleanup(oslo_config.cfg.clear_override) for all
the values that were overriden with set_override.

The tests are always run in random order (i.e. with tox -e py27)
so the conflict does not appear to be deterministic or
guaranteed across all test runs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433724/1
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429978/

Change-Id: Ia17f1d936fcfa15aa19d2099b6385eaf6bb4a1fb
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes cfapi unit test conflicting with other tests.

Currently, test_cfapi appears to be conflicting with other
unit tests [1][2] (see gate-murano-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
in each case).

This is because test_cfapi has a helper method called
_set_override that calls oslo_config.cfg.set_override without
using clearing the overrides during tearDown (i.e. by calling
self.addCleanup(oslo_config.cfg.clear_override) for all
the values that were overriden with set_override.

The tests are always run in random order (i.e. with tox -e py27)
so the conflict does not appear to be deterministic or
guaranteed across all test runs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433724/1
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/429978/

Change-Id: Ia17f1d936fcfa15aa19d2099b6385eaf6bb4a1fb

commit_message:
Add hacking rule to avoid unnecessary space in method

During patch reviews, sometimes reviewers comment to remove spaces
around '=' in method call for consistent coding style. Such kind of
check can be done without human reviews to reduce review workload.
This patch adds the check.

Change-Id: I3d78a959f112aa7251754ac437880b4e839098ea

subject: exc_filter: catch a buggy mysql 1452
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-24 20:43:40.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py'], 'message': "exc_filter: catch a buggy mysql 1452

Mysql sometimes raises an incomplete error 1452:

1452, u'Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails
(Unknown error code)'

This change converts it in an exception.DBReferenceError even if some
information are missing.

Change-Id: I6e0830fb702ecda482aba7648c376afb95b4dcb6
"}]
commit_message:
exc_filter: catch a buggy mysql 1452

Mysql sometimes raises an incomplete error 1452:

1452, u'Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails
(Unknown error code)'

This change converts it in an exception.DBReferenceError even if some
information are missing.

Change-Id: I6e0830fb702ecda482aba7648c376afb95b4dcb6

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-26 01:49:35.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/metadefs-namespaces-tags.inc'], 'message': 'Fix api-ref of "Delete all tag definitions"

Glance returns 200 the success status code on "Delete all tag
definitions" API today, but the api-ref shows 204 as the code.
Tempest also checks 200 as the success status code since the
commit I92b2c58d11828eafd9f876a46581279bb9b26e3d
This patch fixes the api-ref.

Change-Id: Ie42ab08f61f880a13ca4f758243babc205f2629a
Closes-Bug: #1656183
'}]
commit_message:
Fix api-ref of "Delete all tag definitions"

Glance returns 200 the success status code on "Delete all tag
definitions" API today, but the api-ref shows 204 as the code.
Tempest also checks 200 as the success status code since the
commit I92b2c58d11828eafd9f876a46581279bb9b26e3d
This patch fixes the api-ref.

Change-Id: Ie42ab08f61f880a13ca4f758243babc205f2629a
Closes-Bug: #1656183

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 21:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'allocations.consumer_id is not used in query.

PostGreSQL required consumer_id in group by clause, but
consumer_id is not being used in the query and is superfluous.

Change-Id: I47b758b949b7fbed70906e9a95cbe7bb99da13c2
Closes-Bug: 1662012
(cherry picked from commit 85c76a7f0827ff8f278d071a0b3f721847079711)
'}]
commit_message:
allocations.consumer_id is not used in query.

PostGreSQL required consumer_id in group by clause, but
consumer_id is not being used in the query and is superfluous.

Change-Id: I47b758b949b7fbed70906e9a95cbe7bb99da13c2
Closes-Bug: 1662012
(cherry picked from commit 85c76a7f0827ff8f278d071a0b3f721847079711)

Now cinder get-pools can show all backend's info. With filters support,

APIImpact

commit_message:
Add filters support to get_pools

Now cinder get-pools can show all backend's info. With filters support,
api users can get info about one specified backend pool.

Co-Authored-By: Cao ShuFeng<caosf.fnst@cn.fujitsu.com>
APIImpact
Implements: blueprint allow-api-users-to-get-info-about-a-specified-pool

Change-Id: Ia0212287c2b0b9ce2ad2d2a676c9e329c56ec28f

subject: Remove invalid smoke test that is failing in the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-24 16:05:47.000000000', 'files': ['functionaltests/cli/v1/smoke/test_acl.py'], 'message': 'Remove invalid smoke test that is failing in the gate

The smoke test that ran the CLI command "acl delete"
with a null entity_ref was failing with an exception
in the cliff library.  This test is invalid, since
the CLI parser would not accept this command without
an entity_ref.

This test failed more gracefully with cliff 2.3.0, but
in 2.4.0 cliff throws an exception that causes this
test to start failing.

Change-Id: If91d4966eff77dad7c8569e309134dc540edc258
'}]
commit_message:
Remove invalid smoke test that is failing in the gate

The smoke test that ran the CLI command "acl delete"
with a null entity_ref was failing with an exception
in the cliff library.  This test is invalid, since
the CLI parser would not accept this command without
an entity_ref.

This test failed more gracefully with cliff 2.3.0, but
in 2.4.0 cliff throws an exception that causes this
test to start failing.

Change-Id: If91d4966eff77dad7c8569e309134dc540edc258

commit_message:
Containers: Add required EndpointMap parameter

This parameter is passed in by the parent overcloud.yaml template, so we
have to listen accept it in docker/post.j2.yaml, otherwise the
deployment fails.

Change-Id: Ia3fdcfa01d52006a6e9fd0bb02c7379411f3d900
Closes-Bug: #1664569

subject: Fix router port IP address references
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 5803, 'name': 'Attila Fazekas', 'email': 'afazekas@redhat.com', 'username': 'afazekas'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 17776, 'name': 'Reedip', 'email': 'reedip.banerjee@gmail.com', 'username': 'Reedip'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-13 09:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py'], 'message': "Fix router port IP address references

The _verify_network_details method is fetching all
router interfaces, including ones that have nothing
to do with the test details being verified.
So it can end up catching a router interface that is being
cleaned up in a concurrent test which has no IP addresses
anymore.

Additionally, it's currently incompatible with router interfaces
containing multiple fixed IPs from different subnets, which would
be problematic if we added more IPv6 tests since routers attached
to multiple IPv6 subnets on the same network re-use the same
interface.

This patch alters the logic to iterate over the fixed IPs
rather than using a fixed index to work with both multiple IP
cases as well as no IP cases. Additionally, it stops fetching all
ports and just fetches ports with the device_id we are looking for.

Closes-Bug: #1664020
Change-Id: I2134ad8df19290fc7161ef22d80fcb34c8d6266a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix router port IP address references

The _verify_network_details method is fetching all
router interfaces, including ones that have nothing
to do with the test details being verified.
So it can end up catching a router interface that is being
cleaned up in a concurrent test which has no IP addresses
anymore.

Additionally, it's currently incompatible with router interfaces
containing multiple fixed IPs from different subnets, which would
be problematic if we added more IPv6 tests since routers attached
to multiple IPv6 subnets on the same network re-use the same
interface.

This patch alters the logic to iterate over the fixed IPs
rather than using a fixed index to work with both multiple IP
cases as well as no IP cases. Additionally, it stops fetching all
ports and just fetches ports with the device_id we are looking for.

Closes-Bug: #1664020
Change-Id: I2134ad8df19290fc7161ef22d80fcb34c8d6266a

commit_message:
cleanup telemetry data collection

- deprecate api input
- cleanup/remove all pre-Mitaka references
- move compute agent to correct location under polling
- mark kwapi as deprecated in Newton
- correct meter.yaml to meters.yaml
- add metadata field in meters.yaml
- remove volume=1 references since they are gone
- change dispatcher references to publisher since collector is now
deprecated.
- switch configurations to use ceilometer-agent-notification rather
than ceilometer-collector and highlight it's deprecated.
- add Gnocchi and Panko publisher information
- move database publishing to end as it's now deprecated.

Change-Id: I104484e2e1f48f8124f31c5cd5867beba33df27d

commit_message:
debian: default to jessie-backports if it is used as base_tag

Debian/jessie repositories contain very old OpenStack packages.
The ones we want to use are in 'jessie-backports' repository.
So when "--base-tag=jessie-backports" is used we say that we want
those new ones.

V2:
- wrap line to pass pep8 test

Partially-Implements: multiarch-and-arm64-containers

Change-Id: I1cbdee31042392f3e887e3c476e73a90ccee469e
Signed-off-by: Marcin Juszkiewicz <marcin.juszkiewicz@linaro.org>

commit_message:
cleanup telemetry architecture

- expand on ceilometer-agent-notification functionality
- remove ceilometer-agent-* services since they are gone and refer to their
namespace only.
- remove ceilometer-alarm* services. they are deprecated 2+ years ago
and removed 1 year ago
- only gnocchi is officially supported as measurement storage
- aodh (alarms) only supports sql
- panko (events) supports everything else (for now).
- mention gnocchi can be configured without authentication.

Change-Id: Ic1cb8ba012bd546f896b2ce4756e794361bb6d13

commit_message:
Add kingbird client to requirements

Kingbird has released the first version of its client.
Since out intention is to use the client for tempest test
in order to get rid of ugly curl requires.
Since we would like to comply with the global openstack
requirements, we need kingbirdclient to be part of the list
so that we could add it to the requirements.txt

Change-Id: I5247ab6f0f4d9950905fb846c2c6a3ec868ec23b

The Network proxy contains two methods that are mostly there for example
purposes: security_group_allow_ping and security_group_open_port.

and they aren't used anywhere in the SDK or within OSC. They're better

commit_message:
Deprecate port and ping methods in Network proxy

The Network proxy contains two methods that are mostly there for example
purposes: security_group_allow_ping and security_group_open_port.
They haven't been included in documentation due to missing docstrings,
and they aren't used anywhere in the SDK or within OSC. They're better
off as actual examples in our documentation than being within code that
we need to support throughout the future.

Change-Id: I4c6b47860b0c2b952e50d4b564451780008b631a

commit_message:
Change the way how we instantiate fuel client

The issue is that in python-fuelclient API has been
changed and fuelclient.client.APIClient is not available
anymore. It used to be a singleton of fuel client but
now it is deprecated. So, let's use APIClient.default_client
classmethod to instantiate APIClient.

https://github.com/openstack/python-fuelclient/blob/stable/newton/fuelclient/client.py#L51

Change-Id: I5287184c6f1c6abf8ac61894db0bd51fbf730401
Closes-Bug: #1620584
(cherry picked from commit 02b79798451a8d0680313a7ed9af390d114e0896)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.

and assertIs(None, ...)

commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertEqual(None, ...)

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: I9246fac952c59d3ddc1458c16c53fc988ac095d3
(cherry picked from commit 9e1e030c98ecccae640285bd2b38d19124d688e5)

subject: TLS proxy: disable HTTP KeepAlive
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-14 15:59:23.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tls'], 'message': 'TLS proxy: disable HTTP KeepAlive

There's a race condition when a client makes a request "at the same
time" the HTTP connection is being closed by Apache because the
`KeepAliveTimeout` is expired.

This is explained in detail and can be reproduce using
https://github.com/mikem23/keepalive-race or
https://github.com/JordanP/openstack-snippets/blob/master/keepalive-race/keep-alive-race.py

Just disable KeepAlive to fix the
('Connection aborted.', BadStatusLine("''",)) error we are seeing.

Change-Id: I46e9f70ee740ec7996c98d386d5289c1491e9436
'}]
commit_message:
TLS proxy: disable HTTP KeepAlive

There's a race condition when a client makes a request "at the same
time" the HTTP connection is being closed by Apache because the
`KeepAliveTimeout` is expired.

This is explained in detail and can be reproduce using
https://github.com/mikem23/keepalive-race or
https://github.com/JordanP/openstack-snippets/blob/master/keepalive-race/keep-alive-race.py

Just disable KeepAlive to fix the
('Connection aborted.', BadStatusLine("''",)) error we are seeing.

Change-Id: I46e9f70ee740ec7996c98d386d5289c1491e9436

commit_message:
Rename local_network_id for dragonflow

As the lswitch unique key has been assigned in api_nb when
the lswitch is creating, so the lswitch_unique_key is a
global concept for each lport, however the current code still
use 'local_network_id' as the key to store the lswitch_unique_key
which will make the code confuse because it's not a local genarated
value.

Change-Id: I95b7ad345438243465195020442eb13b10b3c632

commit_message:
Remove cgsnapshot_id before snapshot.save

There are a few more places where information is missing for
consistencygroup or cgsnapshot due to the CG migration changes.
This patch tries to fix them.

cgsnapshot_id should be removed from the snapshot object before
snapshot.save is called in the exception block because cgsnapshot
does not exist in the db.

cgsnapshot object is added to the snapshot object when snapshots
are passed to the driver in create/delete cgsnapshot.

Change-Id: I253a98b8a2058a00c2c577927c0b701c2f88c81b
Closes-Bug: #1662684
(cherry picked from commit 702868fd00e6b99d7ae5bda64d3410b2e5f9ddc5)

commit_message:
OVN plugin configuration fixes

This patch renames certain ovn plugin and controller configuration
parameters as well as adds some additional ml2 configuration parameters.
It also disables the need for the neutron metadata agent.

commit_message:
Add i18n to Notifications

Adding i18n to the Notifications is a little different to other
components because the title and message are defined outside the
component, often coming from external web service calls.

This patch adds an extra thunk parameter which can be used inside
actions to translate strings.

Change-Id: I6335c6ccb92e3077ba6400fa6364446a757863eb

These were assumed to be always passed, but as the script gets

Change-Id: I195321354df167c09cfc87c5b9f86c6dc5026d75

commit_message:
Declare variables for freeipa_setup.sh script

These were assumed to be always passed, but as the script gets
different cases (novajoin vs pre-defined service principals) we might
get "unbound variable" errors when used outside of CI. Exporting these
variables beforehand prevents that.

Change-Id: I195321354df167c09cfc87c5b9f86c6dc5026d75

commit_message:
Remove unsupported connect route

In Neutron side, if we create a subnet with host routes, we must
give the nexthop, so it seems this doesn't match the Libnetwork
remote driver spec.

This patch remove the connect route info in join_response.

Change-Id: Ic927f080df3a162503bf077be9e56361c06c2e3b
Closes-Bug: #1663110

commit_message:
Update restore status in restore page

When watching the restore page, update (poll?) the restore
status. If a restore is in_progress, user shouldn't refresh
the page to see it is success.

Change-Id: Idca8860f726eaf5a450e8335b112b9d845b26377
Co-authored-by: xiangxinyong <xiangxinyong@huawei.com>
(cherry picked from commit aec32d550800040cc658d241f7cfd22e4c5604fe)

commit_message:
Update documentation to deploy Ironic Inspector with DevStack

Current documentation to deploy ironic-inspector with DevStack needs
an update similar to the ironic project.

This patch modifies/updates a section "DevStack Support". Also, it
updates the example.local.conf to a configuration that can be used
as-is to deploy ironic-inspector with DevStack.

Change-Id: I0a4a5198246e3ca69d2bd050dd31c6b468094fcf

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests

Instead of assertTrue and assertFalse use more specific asserts.
They are compatible with Python 2.7[1] and 3.4[2]

[1]: https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html
[2]: https://docs.python.org/3.4/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I9b07cc324757f35b1e8431b715412bf5d7fa8ecb

commit_message:
[puppet4] Fix noop tests

Because of https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/issues/253 array of hashes in Puppet3
is interpreted as array of arrays in rspec-puppet

Change-Id: I85f14880ba55277afa1df1e07f05fd893bff4c46
Closes-Bug: #1663563

commit_message:
Fix incorrect example for querying resource for RP.

Use comma for splitting resource query in the URL.
But the example does not comply with this rule.
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Iecc73b2cdb514bfea970187415319d869e4cf61f

subject: Remove support for py34
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 03:43:38.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibee4ecb67eaba930a03ea6476b914e13e6640b1e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ibee4ecb67eaba930a03ea6476b914e13e6640b1e

subject: Remove  N342 from pep8 ignore list
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-13 06:45:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Remove  N342 from pep8 ignore list

Current N342 is the nova check for central conf files.

We can just remove it from the ignore list. Hopefully, future rule
will be added in neutron-lib for such check in networking project.

commit_message:
Remove  N342 from pep8 ignore list

Current N342 is the nova check for central conf files.
[N342] Config options should be in the central location nova/conf/
We can just remove it from the ignore list. Hopefully, future rule
will be added in neutron-lib for such check in networking project.

Change-Id: Ib4d3eadeb100ea26f7ccfeaca14a219c29e43c2e
Partial-Bug: #1663864

subject: Use buffer to cache original data
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 13:44:20.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_l3_app.py'], 'message': "Use buffer to cache original data

The l3_app.L3App acts as learning router. Every routing will create
a OpenFlow rule for following packets, while the first packet also
needs to put back to the OpenFlow pipeline.

The original code doesn't add action to output to a port, so the
packet is siliently dropped.

This patch uses a buffer at datapath to store the packet, and specify
the buffer when add flow. The stored packet will be processed by the
new flow, so the pipeline is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib40d3d0204d719503be52946fdb159e059bde2f2
Closes-Bug: #1663515
"}]
commit_message:
Use buffer to cache original data

The l3_app.L3App acts as learning router. Every routing will create
a OpenFlow rule for following packets, while the first packet also
needs to put back to the OpenFlow pipeline.

The original code doesn't add action to output to a port, so the
packet is siliently dropped.

This patch uses a buffer at datapath to store the packet, and specify
the buffer when add flow. The stored packet will be processed by the
new flow, so the pipeline is not broken.

Change-Id: Ib40d3d0204d719503be52946fdb159e059bde2f2
Closes-Bug: #1663515

subject: Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-14 02:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/common/icmp_error_generator.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_proactive_app.py'], 'message': 'Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message

Depending on whether running l3 agent, the router interface could be
either concrete or virtual.

A concrete router interface will have ovs port to respond the various
IP connection. We can just direct packets to the ovs port.

A virtual router interface is a logic concept, but vms are not aware
of that. The icmp respondor will respond icmp echo request, while this
patch add udp and tcp respondor with the reply of icmp unreachable
message. This is the same as the concrete port, and can make the traceroute
to virtual router interface work.

Change-Id: I73cfc401e153000d9565ab8331ed00fb0be8494c
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
(cherry picked from commit b54b17b6f71a95670db4215ca08cae02bcfd359c)
'}]
commit_message:
Respond udp and tcp to router port with icmp unreachable message

Depending on whether running l3 agent, the router interface could be
either concrete or virtual.

A concrete router interface will have ovs port to respond the various
IP connection. We can just direct packets to the ovs port.

A virtual router interface is a logic concept, but vms are not aware
of that. The icmp respondor will respond icmp echo request, while this
patch add udp and tcp respondor with the reply of icmp unreachable
message. This is the same as the concrete port, and can make the traceroute
to virtual router interface work.

Change-Id: I73cfc401e153000d9565ab8331ed00fb0be8494c
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
(cherry picked from commit b54b17b6f71a95670db4215ca08cae02bcfd359c)

commit_message:
Add H233 to pep8 check

H233 will report error when print is used as operator.
print operator has been removed in py3. We should add H233 check
as py3 is in the support list. This problem was first found at [1]
We can launch the check for future code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396915/

Change-Id: I4fef99c24941f048fd61a808e03869bacd30c001
Co-Authored-By: Wang Jian <wangjian38@huawei.com>
Partial-Bug: #1663864
(cherry picked from commit f05852e71073f0b03ab96f8ebb22ab374b3e3f51)

After routing, the packet will traverse in the destination network.

security group(or connection tracker) can track the state of
connection in correct zone.

Closes-Bug: #1663509
(cherry picked from commit 2d67c6371516e9ee375f5feba016a4253776fde8)

commit_message:
Modify metadata of packet when route

After routing, the packet will traverse in the destination network.
It is necessary to change the packet metadata when route, so that the
security group(or connection tracker) can track the state of
connection in correct zone.

Change-Id: I7b23eee112ef10f0fc636f39ed96556ee6fb796e
Closes-Bug: #1663509
(cherry picked from commit 2d67c6371516e9ee375f5feba016a4253776fde8)

commit_message:
Deploy the undercloud with Heat

This patch adds a new 'undercloud deploy' option which:

 -installs and configures os-collect-config, and hooks using instack

 -forks an all-in-one heat-api/engine process using noauth

 -spawn our own fake keystone thread for noauth Heat

 -creates a Heat stack for the undercloud using t-h-t

 -starts os-collect-config to drive the deployment of Heat
  metadata

Partially-implements: blueprint heat-undercloud

Depends-On: I50a8cc46b4c3c235d438a711760fba94bf8e9715
Depends-On: I36df7fa86c2ff40026d59f02248af529a4a81861

Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-by: Flavio Percoco <flaper87@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib05062e3710aeec922988d5f1308be44b5468473

commit_message:
Add unique key to router

We are handling all routers in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE, adding an
identification to distinguish packets that belongs to different
routers would be helpful. It also makes it possible to optimize
the flow rules for router.

Change-Id: I867193665fea74bc44d0429789328a4bd0f74dea
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
Partial-Bug: #1635509
(cherry picked from commit b375ec86cfd8ba01fb73848ed7985332c0d61cbb)

commit_message:
Remove old iSCSI initiator utils modules

Now that we have an iSCSI initiator module that uses the iscsidsc
lib directly, there is no need to keep the old modules that were
using iscsicli.exe or WMI for interacting with the MS iSCSI
initiator.

Nova stopped using the old modules since Mitaka. As 2 cycles have
passed, we can now completely remove them along with the according
config option.

Change-Id: Id514a15646aaacb8f90c998ae51381e2a868edd1

commit_message:
Add some logs and fix the get_allowed_*() methods

This patch is adding logs to some parts of the library to help with
troubleshooting it.

The patch also fixes a problem with the get_alllowed_*() methods from
System. When the allowed values are not found in the resource JSON we
should return all values known to Sushy instead of an empty list.

Change-Id: Ifb29c85eaef47f7e112621d1c6cad4315f4c4578

[{'number': 23, 'created': '2017-02-13 14:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector_client/v1.py', 'doc/source/cli.rst', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/functional.py', 'releasenotes/notes/interface-list-show-39cedaca3cd9db9b.yaml', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/test_v1.py', 'ironic_inspector_client/test/test_shell.py', 'setup.cfg', 'ironic_inspector_client/resource.py', 'ironic_inspector_client/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add new introspection commands for interface data including lldp

The new commands are "interface list <uuid>" and "interface show

commit_message:
Add new introspection commands for interface data including lldp

This adds two new baremetal introspection commands to display
interface data, including switch information from lldp packets, as
described in the lldp-reporting.rst specification
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-inspector-specs/
specs/lldp-reporting.html.

The new commands are "interface list <uuid>" and "interface show
<uuid> <interface>".  The list command will show specific interface
fields for all interfaces in a node; additional fields can be
displayed using the "--fields" argument.  The show command will
show all interface fields for a particular node and interface.

Change-Id: I40d348c4fefffb85affb14f3d224a8d4bf4fb297
Closes-Bug: 1626253
Related-Bug: 1647515
Depends-On: I854826787ff045ffb2807970deaba8b77cbe277d

commit_message:
OpenDaylight BGPVPN Version 2 Driver

The Version 1 driver for BGPVPN resides in the
networking-bgpvpn repository here:

https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/tree/master/networking_bgpvpn/
neutron/services/service_drivers/opendaylight/odl.py

It will be deprecated in next Openstack Pike release,
as default will be version 2 driver for all services
by that release for OpenDaylight deployments.

TODO:
The following will come in subsequent reviews:

a. Full stack tests.

b. Functional tests.

c. Bring the delete_bgpvpn, delete_net_assoc and
delete_router_assoc into precommit after fixing
the base BGPVPN Plugin in networking-bgpvpn repo.

d. Fix the BGPVPN Plugin to use the same DB transaction
(that it uses to write to Openstack DB), when invoking
_precommit of service-drivers.

A bug has been raised to address both c and d
inside networking-bgpvpn plugin here:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bgpvpn/+bug/1664637

Closes-Bug: #1656903
Partial-Bug: #1632117
Co-Authored-by: Vishal Thapar <vishal.thapar@ericsson.com>
Change-Id: I08485db8f10f15591d70474a4b8546990d4de166
